titleStmt.title: Digital Edition of Glaser Abklatsch ID: AT-OeAW-BA-3-27-P-28
AT-OeAW-BA-3-27-P-28

item.term: Early first millennium to the fourth century BC (predominance of Saba)
Fourth to first centuries BC (predominance of Qataban and Hadramawt, and their alliance with Main)
First century BC to early second century AD (alliances between the tribes of the high plateau and the ASA kingdoms)
Late second to late third centuries AD (wars among the Himyar, Saba and Hadramawt)
Fourth to sixth centuries AD (unification of Yemen under Himyarite rule)
It corresponds to the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans with sub-periods I-IV
First sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans
Second sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans
Second sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans
Second sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans
Third sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans
Fourth sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans
Fourth sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans

b-ʿṯtr w-b ʿm w-b ʾnby w-b ḏt ṣntm
w-b ydʿʾb ḏbyn w-bn-hw šhrm

1.[Fari]ʿkarib Dhū-Dhariḥān bin Shahr--the official and priest, and during his period in office as priest, 2.the interpreter of the oracles of ʿAmm from Marqadum, the collector of the (sacrificial) lambs, according to the oracles of ʿAmm and Ḥawkam, when 3.he interpreted the oracles of ʿAmm from Naʿiḍ and Ḥawkam from Qalay, and the dedicant together with 4.the administrators(?) of Qalabān, and the dedicant of the shrine in Banaʾ--has dedicated to Warakh and Ḥaramān 5.(this) limsteone slab, as he had vowed to them. He has committed to Warakh and Ḥaramān his person 6.and his faculties and his sons, Ghaḍirān and ʾAnmārum, and all of his (other) children, and (his) possessions. 7.By ʿAthtar, and by ʿAmm, and by ʾAnbay, and by Dhāt-Ṣanatam, and by Dh[...], 8.and by Yadaʿʾab Dhubyān and his son Shahrum, the king[... ...].

Fariʿkarib Dhū-Dhariḥān bin Shahr--the official and priest, and during his period in office as priest,
the interpreter of the oracles of ʿAmm from Marqadum, the collector of the sacrificial lambs, according to the oracles of ʿAmm and Ḥawkam, when
he interpreted the oracles of ʿAmm from Naʿiḍ and Ḥawkam from Qalay, and the dedicant together with
the administrators? of Qalabān, and the dedicant of the shrine in Banaʾ--has dedicated to Warakh and Ḥaramān
this limsteone slab, as he had vowed to them. He has committed to Warakh and Ḥaramān his person
and his faculties and his sons, Ghaḍirān and ʾAnmārum, and all of his other children, and his possessions.
By ʿAthtar, and by ʿAmm, and by ʾAnbay, and by Dhāt-Ṣanatam, and by Dh...,
and by Yadaʿʾab Dhubyān and his son Shahrum, the king
.

Fariʿkarib Dhū-Dhariḥān bin Shahr--the official and priest, and during his period in office as priest,
the interpreter of the oracles of ʿAmm from Marqadum, the collector of the sacrificial lambs, according to the oracles of ʿAmm and Ḥawkam, when
he interpreted the oracles of ʿAmm from Naʿiḍ and Ḥawkam from Qalay, and the dedicant together with
the administrators? of Qalabān, and the dedicant of the shrine in Banaʾ--has dedicated to Warakh and Ḥaramān
this limsteone slab, as he had vowed to them. He has committed to Warakh and Ḥaramān his person
and his faculties and his sons, Ghaḍirān and ʾAnmārum, and all of his other children, and his possessions.
By ʿAthtar, and by ʿAmm, and by ʾAnbay, and by Dhāt-Ṣanatam, and by Dh...,
and by Yadaʿʾab Dhubyān and his son Shahrum, the king.

Fariʿkarib Dhū-Dhariḥān bin Shahr--the official and priest, and during his period in office as priest,
the interpreter of the oracles of ʿAmm from Marqadum, the collector of the sacrificial lambs, according to the oracles of ʿAmm and Ḥawkam, when
he interpreted the oracles of ʿAmm from Naʿiḍ and Ḥawkam from Qalay, and the dedicant together with
the administrators? of Qalabān, and the dedicant of the shrine in Banaʾ--has dedicated to Warakh and Ḥaramān
this limsteone slab, as he had vowed to them. He has committed to Warakh and Ḥaramān his person
and his faculties and his sons, Ghaḍirān and ʾAnmārum, and all of his other children, and his possessions.
By ʿAthtar, and by ʿAmm, and by ʾAnbay, and by Dhāt-Ṣanatam, and by Dh...,
and by Yadaʿʾab Dhubyān and his son Shahrum, the king.

bibl.seg: Avanzini, Alessandra 1995. As-Sawdāʾ. Inventaire des inscriptions sudarabiques. 4. Paris: de Boccard / Rome: Herder. [Académie des Inscriptions et Belles-lettres; Istituto italiano per l'Africa e l'Oriente]
